name: 蕭榮修
objective:
1. Sample Space and Probability
2. Discrete Random Variables
3. General Random Variables
4. Further Topics on Random Variables
5. Stochastic Processes
6. Markov Chains
7. Limit Theorems
schedule:
1. Introduction
2. Sets, Probabilistic Models,Conditional Probability
3. Independence, Total Probability Theorem and Bayes’ Rule
4. Discrete Random Variables Comcepts, Probability Mass Functions, The Bernoulli Random Variable, The Binomial Random Variable
5. The Geometric Random Variable, The Poisson Random Variable
6. Expectation, Mean, and Variance
7. Mid-term Exam 1
8. JOINT PMFS OF MULTIPLE RANDOM VARIABLES
9. Conditioning and Independence
10. Continuous Random Variables and PDFs
11. Cumulative Distribution Functions, Normal Random Variables
12. Exponential Random Variables, Conditioning on an Event, Multiple Continuous Random Variables
13. Mid-term Exam 2
14. Transforms, Moment Generation Function
15. Covariance and Correlation
16. Stochastic Process
17. Markov Chains, Limit Theorems
18. Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Homework 20%
Midterm I 25%
Midterm II 25% 
Final Exam 30%
materials:
1. Bertsekas, Dimitri P., and John N. Tsitsiklis. Introduction to Probability. Belmont, MA: Athena Scientific Press, June 2002. ISBN: 188652940X. (全華)
2. A Course in Probability, Neil. A. Weiss, Pearson, 2006. (歐亞)
